A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
There were so many wasted opportuniites for greatness even within this disaster of a plot line. 

Minor spoilers:

The Plot
The plot takes us almost nowhere and sacrifices main characters for little to no reason. It seem Rian Johnson wanted to Game-of-thrones-ify the star wars universe by violating expectations above all else.  This misses the point.  Star wars was built on the formula of myth making (see A Hero with A Thousand Faces).  People haven't gotten tired of the heroes journey for thousands of years.  Now Rian Johnson wants us to "let the past die. Kill it if you have to". If you are going to forge an entirely new path you had better have a good story to tell.  So far it seems he has nothing but pointless quests to send characters on. If you have to rely on a follow up movie to rescue yours\, you've made a bad movie.

The wasted opportunities
Leia's character is revealed to be stronger than anyone knew\, but sits on the sidelines the whole time. With Carrie Fisher's passing we will never see it on screen.

Luke is completely out of character almost the whole time. It's like introducing Superman into a movie except now he is fat and depressed and only wants to talk about bowling. Luke has been building towards greatness since the beginning of star wars and we never get to see it on screen.  

Rey is the protagonist\, right? In this movie Rey is a sideline character that barely contributes to the story. This is probably not ideal. Her whole arc is striving for identity and mentorship and we waste the whole moving giving her none of it. She spends the entire 1st movie trying to find Luke.  Once she finds him it turns out to be pointless. How does a character progress without learning anything form anyone or discovering anything about herself?
